verses.verse: (Praise to the LORD for His Love and Faithfulness) A Psalm. A Song for the Sabbath day. [1] It is (Ps. 147:1) good to give thanks to the LORD, And to sing praises to Your name, O Most High;
To (Ps. 89:1) declare Your lovingkindness in the morning, And Your faithfulness every night,
(1 Chr. 23:5) On an instrument of ten strings, On the lute, And on the harp, With harmonious sound.
For You, LORD, have made me glad through Your work; I will triumph in the works of Your hands.
(Ps. 40:5; (Rev. 15:3)) O LORD, how great are Your works! (Ps. 139:17, 18; (Is. 28:29; Rom. 11:33, 34)) Your thoughts are very deep.
(Ps. 73:22) A senseless man does not know, Nor does a fool understand this.
When (Job 12:6; Ps. 37:1, 2; Jer. 12:1, 2; (Mal. 3:15)) the wicked spring up like grass, And when all the workers of iniquity flourish, It is that they may be destroyed forever.
((Ps. 83:18)) But You, LORD, are on high forevermore.
For behold, Your enemies, O LORD, For behold, Your enemies shall perish; All the workers of iniquity shall (Ps. 68:1) be scattered.
But (Ps. 89:17) my horn You have exalted like a wild ox; I have been (Ps. 23:5) anointed with fresh oil.
(Ps. 54:7) My eye also has seen my desire on my enemies; My ears hear my desire on the wicked Who rise up against me.
(Num. 24:6; Ps. 52:8; Jer. 17:8; Hos. 14:5, 6) The righteous shall flourish like a palm tree, He shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
Those who are planted in the house of the LORD Shall flourish in the courts of our God.
They shall still bear fruit in old age; They shall be fresh and flourishing,
To declare that the LORD is upright; ((Deut. 32:4)) He is my rock, and ((Rom. 9:14)) there is no unrighteousness in Him.
